I mean, four years and eight months ago, I testified before the same body, the Senate Judiciary Committee, and said that, if President Bush has his way and has his own set of military commission trials without congressional authorization, the result will be no convictions and the Supreme Court overturning President Bush's decision.

Congress, in 1916, passed a law that said that trials of terrorism suspects can take place in these Courts Martial, and they're on the books now and we've used them hundreds of times in the battlefields of Iraq and Afghanistan.

If we adopt the Bush Administration's solution, as some new fangled system, the result is going to be a whole bunch more litigation right now, tied up in courts for years, again, and perhaps again, a reversal by the Supreme Court if these policies are adopted, of not really having fair trials.
